journal_title: International Journal of Mathematics and Mathematical Sciences
description: We use the geometric data to define a bordism invariant for the fiberwise intersection theory. Under some certain conditions, this invariant is an obstruction for the theory. Moreover, we prove the converse of fiberwise Lefschetz fixed point theorem.
title: A Bordism Viewpoint of Fiberwise Intersections
A Bordism Viewpoint of Fiberwise Intersections
abstract: We use the geometric data to define a bordism invariant for the fiberwise intersection theory. Under some certain conditions, this invariant is an obstruction for the theory. Moreover, we prove the converse of fiberwise Lefschetz fixed point theorem.
source: International Journal of Mathematics and Mathematical Sciences
creator: Sunyeekhan, Gun

references: • F. Wecken, “Fixpunktklassen. I,” Mathematische Annalen, vol. 117, pp. 659–671, 1941 (German). View at MathSciNet

• J. Nielsen, “Über die Minimalzahl der Fixpunkte bei den Abbildungstypen der Ringflächen,” Mathematische Annalen, vol. 82, no. 1-2, pp. 83–93, 1920 (German). View at Publisher · View at Google Scholar · View at MathSciNet

• B. J. Jiang, “Fixed point classes from a differential viewpoint,” in Fixed Point Theory (Sherbrooke, Que., 1980), vol. 886 of Lecture Notes in Mathematics, pp. 163–170, Springer, Berlin, Germany, 1981. View at Publisher · View at Google Scholar · View at Zentralblatt MATH · View at MathSciNet

• T. Ko\'zniewski, “The category of submersions,” L'Académie Polonaise des Sciences. Bulletin. Série des Sciences Mathématiques, vol. 27, no. 3-4, pp. 321–326, 1979. View at Zentralblatt MATH · View at MathSciNet

• A. Hatcher and F. Quinn, “Bordism invariants of intersections of submanifolds,” Transactions of the American Mathematical Society, vol. 200, pp. 327–344, 1974. View at Publisher · View at Google Scholar · View at Zentralblatt MATH · View at MathSciNet
• G. Sunyeekhan, Equivariant intersection theory [Ph.D. thesis], University of Notre Dame, Notre Dame, Indiana, 2010.
• V. Coufal, A family version of Lefschetz-Nielsen fixed point theory [Ph.D. thesis], University of Notre Dame, Notre Dame, Indiana, 2004.
